_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT OUR FACILITY

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPCRA 302 REQUIREMENTS FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE AND IT IS OUR POLICY TO ADHERE TO ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LAWS.  IF AN EMERGENCY WERE TO OCCUR, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE ARCHER FIRE DEPARTMENT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.  OUR POLICY ALSO IS TO EVACUATE ANY PEOPLE IN THE AREA AFFECTED AND NOTIFY THE LOCAL AND THE NATIONAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE CENTERS IF THE RELEASE IS MORE THAN 100 LBS.  

A DESCRIPTION OF OUR FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:

THIS FACILITY IS A GRAIN ELEVATOR.  WE DRY AND STORE GRAIN, CUSTOM MILL FEED, SELL DRY FERTILIZER, LIQUID NITROGEN (28-0-0), ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, AG CHEMICALS, AND ALSO CUSTOM APPLY FERTILIZER AND HERBICIDES.  WE USE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FOR A NITROGEN SOURCE FOR FIELD CORN.  THE AMMONIA PLANT CONSISTS OF TWO STORAGE TANKS - ONE 113,415 LB TANK AND ONE 52,930 LB TANK - AND ASSOCIATED PIPING, VALVES, AND NURSE TANK CONNECTORS ON THE FILL RISERS.  WE ALSO HAVE 25 NURSE TANKS TOTALING 122,570 LBS.  TOTAL ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE ON SITE IS 288,915 LBS.  

THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO:

OUR WORST CASE SCENARIO IS A FAILURE OF AN EXCESS FLOW VALVE OR BROKEN PIPE CAUSING A SUDDEN RELEASE OF LIQUID AND VAPOR CAUSING A TOXIC PLUME.  ACCORDING TO EPA LOOKUP TABLES, THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT IS 3.6 MILES WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 373 PEOPLE.  

ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO

OUR ALTERNATIVE SCENARIO IS A FAILURE OF A PRESSURE RELIEF VALVE CAUSING A VAPOR CLOUD WITHIN AN ENDPOINT OF 0.5 MILES.

  THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS.  

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENT PREVENTION RULE AND APPLICABLE STATE AND LOCAL CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THE ANHYDROUS AMMOUNIA SYSTEM IS DESIGNED, INSTALLED, AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPCRA 302 AND ANSI STANDARDS.  

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

WE HAVE NEVER HAD AN ACCIDENT INVOLV

ING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAUSED DEATH, INJURIES, PROPERTY OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.  EVACUATIONS OR SHELTERINGS ARE IN PLACE.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SYSTEM, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE ARCHER FIRE DEPARTMENT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.  THEN EVACUATE PPEOPLE AND NOTIFY THE LOCAL AND NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER IF THE LEAK AMOUNTS TO MORE THAN 100 LBS.  

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

NONE.
